## Why Regional Coordination Matters

### The Challenge:

```{r}
#| echo: false
#| fig-align: center

tibble(
  issue = c("Scattered Data", "Inconsistent Methods", "No Communication", "Weak Capacity", "Lost Knowledge"),
  consequence = c("Can't see trends", "Results unreliable", "Duplication", "Unsustainable", "Repeat mistakes"),
  solution = c("Central database", "Standardized protocols", "Regular meetings", "Joint training", "Documentation")
) |>
  ggplot(aes(x = issue, y = 1, fill = issue)) +
  geom_col(alpha = 0.8) +
  scale_fill_brewer(palette = 'Set2', guide = 'none') +
  geom_text(aes(label = consequence), nudge_y = 0.3, size = 3, fontface = 'bold') +
  geom_text(aes(label = solution), nudge_y = -0.3, size = 2.5, color = 'white') +
  ylim(0, 1.5) +
  theme_minimal() +
  theme(
    axis.text.y = element_blank(),
    axis.title = element_blank(),
    panel.grid = element_blank(),
    axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 45, hjust = 1)
  )
```

## Regional Coordinator Role

### Job Description:

```r
# POSITION: Regional Fisheries Monitoring Coordinator
# 
# QUALIFICATIONS:
# - Diploma/degree in fisheries, biology, or related field
# - Experience in data collection preferred
# - Fluent in Somali and English
# - Computer literacy
# - Strong communication skills
#
# KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:
# 1. Oversee monthly data collection at landing sites
# 2. Maintain database and backup systems
# 3. Conduct monthly data analysis
# 4. Prepare quarterly reports
# 5. Lead community engagement activities
# 6. Implement quality assurance procedures
# 7. Support TAFIRI training activities
# 8. Attend quarterly national meetings
#
# PERFORMANCE METRICS:
# - Data quality: >95% complete, <2% error rate
# - Timeliness: All reports on schedule
# - Coverage: All sites monitored monthly
# - Stakeholder satisfaction: >80% positive feedback
```

## Standardized Protocols Across Regions

### Universal Data Collection Standard:

```r
# File structure all regions must follow
standardized_template <- list(
  data = list(
    landing_date = "YYYY-MM-DD",
    region = "One of 6 regions",
    landing_site = "Specific site name",
    fish_group = "Standard taxonomy",
    length_cm = "Numeric, ¬±0.1cm",
    weight_kg = "Numeric, ¬±0.1kg",
    metadata = list(
      observer = "Name",
      sampler_id = "Unique ID",
      effort = "Landing count",
      notes = "Any issues"
    )
  ),
  quality_checks = list(
    range_validation = "Length 5-200cm, Weight 0.1-500kg",
    completeness = "No missing critical fields",
    timeliness = "Entered within 24 hours",
    duplication = "No exact duplicates"
  ),
  reporting = list(
    monthly = "By 5th of following month",
    quarterly = "By 15th of quarter start",
    annual = "By end of Q1 next year"
  )
)
```

## Integration with Policy Makers

### Translating Data to Policy:

```r
# Example: How data informs management decisions

# Data insight
mean_length_declining <- data |>
  group_by(year) |>
  summarise(mean_L = mean(length_cm)) |>
  pull(mean_L) |>
  diff() < 0  # Negative trend

# Policy implications
if (mean_length_declining) {
  
  recommendations <- c(
    "Consider reducing catch limits by 10%",
    "Implement minimum size regulations",
    "Restrict access to juvenile habitat",
    "Monitor recruitment closely",
    "Engage fishers in co-management"
  )
  
  return(recommendations)
}
```

## Lessons from TAFIRI Experience

### Applied to Somalia:

::: {.incremental}
1. **Start with committed partners** - Not every region ready simultaneously
2. **Build incrementally** - Small successes lead to bigger support
3. **Invest in people** - Staff development > equipment spending
4. **Document everything** - Procedures survive staff turnover
5. **Maintain data integrity** - QC is continuous, not final
6. **Link to policy** - Data only valuable if used
7. **Engage communities** - Fishers are essential partners
8. **Plan for sustainability** - Think beyond project duration
:::
